DataElement.preferredDefinition: Information regarding why Tyrosine Kinase Inhibitor medication change.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any substance that inhibits tyrosine kinase, an enzyme involved in the transduction and processing of many extracellular and intracellular signals including cell proliferation. Inhibition of tyrosine kinase may result in inhibition of cell growth and cell proliferation._The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Substances that inhibit tyrosine kinase enzymes, involved with the transduction and processing of many extracellular and intracellular signals including cell proliferation. They have numerous applications in the prevention and treatment of cancer. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: Any substance that inhibits tyrosine kinase, an enzyme involved in the transduction and processing of many extracellular and intracellular signals including cell proliferation. Inhibition of tyrosine kinase may result in inhibition of cell growth and cell proliferation.
The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A category of organic or inorganic substances, elements, and isotopes used in research or for the prevention, diagnosis, and/or treatment of disease states. Includes biologically active substances that are either synthetically manufactured or endogenous substances extracted and processed to be reintroduced into an organism. Chemicals and drugs also include hazardous substances, and naturally occurring or synthetically produced substances required to maintain life.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The establishment of a state or result.: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.: A state of curiosity or concern about or attention to something.: A doctor; a person who has been educated, trained, and licensed to practice the art and science of medicine; a practitioner of medicine, as contrasted with a surgeon.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: To cease active participation in; remove from active use.: An inability to absorb or metabolize certain substances in the normal way.: Any substance that inhibits tyrosine kinase, an enzyme involved in the transduction and processing of many extracellular and intracellular signals including cell proliferation. Inhibition of tyrosine kinase may result in inhibition of cell growth and cell proliferation.

Any substance that inhibits tyrosine kinase, an enzyme involved in the transduction and processing of many extracellular and intracellular signals including cell proliferation. Inhibition of tyrosine kinase may result in inhibition of cell growth and cell proliferation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects of something.
